TopicTitle: PBK-1 "Katarina" Multi Mission Flying Boat, for all your 1.0.5 maritime security needs

Articles.Content:
PBK-1 Katarina

Multi-Mission Flying Boat

Stock 1.0.5 Amphibious Aircraft - Download @ KerbalX

Description:

The PBK-1 is a new generation of low-cost, high efficiency armed maritime patrol aircraft made possible courtesy of cutting-edge small-diameter turbine technology in KSP 1.0.5. It is intended for coastal operations ranging from armed patrol to amphibious transport.

The Katarina's unique planing hull design reduces hydrodynamic drag during its takeoff run. Water landing speeds are in the range of 35-50m/s - watch the sink rate! Activate flaps (Action Group 2) for takeoff.

Optional (stock) air to ground missiles fitted to increase possibility of sales to private Kerbal military companies and nation-states.
Great design, dude! Vintage seaplanes have always been some of my favorite designs. I'm glad the overhauled hydrodynamics allows us to actually build them now

Beat me to it, I see. I built a (failed) flying boat yesterday named the PBK. It had a custom interior inside it with bunks and a navigation table and such, but it failed to get out of the water, the torpedoes failed, and the rear compartment flooded.

Nice plane though, It makes me want to give flying boats another go.

To the SPH!!!
Yeah this looks lovely, very 'sea-plane-y'. Reminds me of some olf Russian sea planes, with that nose it has. Good job man, and thanks Squad for better water!
Lol wow, that thing looks great

This plane has inspired me to begin design of the PFB (Plagiarized Flying Boat), which is pretty much a copy of yours. But hey, it's different in some aspects, right?

I'm still working on the "Flying" part, but the "Boat" part is perfected!

KSC Coast Guard seaplane rescue missions anyone? Working on a few contract ideas now: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138997-WIP-Contract-Pack-SSI-Aerospace-%280-0-1a%29-Early-Career-Air-Charters-%28Giving-Aircraft-a-Purpose%29
Looks fantastic man! And it handles just like the real thing, awesome!
I like it!

This plane has inspired me to begin design of the PFB (Plagiarized Flying Boat), which is pretty much a copy of yours. But hey, it's different in some aspects, right?

http://i.imgur.com/qCkWL1W.png

I'm still working on the "Flying" part, but the "Boat" part is perfected!

I like it! Good adaptation and yours looks closer to the proportions of a radial engine flying boat. I was half expecting to see a larger ship as per your earlier post, having a flyable PBK with walkable interior would be all kinds of awesome. With a Mk3 size design you could launch boats and submarines off the back too. I think a lot of people are playing SeaKuest DSV at the moment

One thing on planes with interiors, they work better in FAR as the voxel model doesn't add drag for clipped or internally mounted parts.

KSC Coast Guard seaplane rescue missions anyone? Working on a few contract ideas now: http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138997-WIP-Contract-Pack-SSI-Aerospace-%280-0-1a%29-Early-Career-Air-Charters-%28Giving-Aircraft-a-Purpose%29

Yes please! I would like to fly air sea rescue missions or even buoy and sensor placement flights; more variety over current rescue missions, and Navy seaplanes were used to drop stuff over the ocean too.

It would be fun if the contracts spawned simple boat like targets too, I could make you some low poly lifeboats and civilian craft. Or just use round8 tanks as life preservers.

Yeah this looks lovely, very 'sea-plane-y'. Reminds me of some olf Russian sea planes, with that nose it has. Good job man, and thanks Squad for better water!

The better water and the new Porkjet plane parts are definitely worth releasing early. The turbofan, afterburner option and the Mk1 crew pod are often in demand.

The water is ridiculously fun to crash into and I was surprised we are able to dive underwater now. Squad once upon a time stated underwater operations won't be a priority due to space focus, but the same could be said for spaceplanes too - I once lobbied on the forums for mirror symmetry and some other plane related features.

I like it!

I'm looking forward to even better designs from you

I might carry on building different types of seaplanes, maybe a Be-200 or even an ekranoplan. We don't have ground effect simulation but with the stall speed in stock aero so low it could be fudged well enough to look the part.

Yes please! I would like to fly air sea rescue missions or even buoy and sensor placement flights; more variety over current rescue missions, and Navy seaplanes were used to drop stuff over the ocean too.

It would be fun if the contracts spawned simple boat like targets too, I could make you some low poly lifeboats and civilian craft. Or just use round8 tanks as life preservers.

Contracts can spawn Kerbals and crafts (shssh dont tell anyone, its my lil secret)... with Contract Configurator. Working on a rescue mission tonight in fact to try spawning a boat. I just need a boat to spawn test. Kerbalx here I come. Spawning craft is not easy though... I tried spawning my STS Space Shuttle on KSC Island... to explosive effect. But hey, if you can make me a few boat crafts, I'll incorporate the best of them in the Contract Pack. PM me when you post them. Two nights ago I was able to successfully spawn aircraft on KSC Island as part of contract. The skies the limit... except my STS ... i have hope.

Hey Kitten

That is such a beautiful design, and since the cattalina was my favorite plane in my childhood - I´m sorry, I had to copy that. I hope you don´t mind.

And it is the perfect plane to test that reverse thrust propulsion idea.

 

 

 

She flies like a charm. You´ve created an absolute masterpiece there.

Cheers Mü

I happen to have two boat building "contracts" and am going to start work on some basic small craft and maybe chop apart my old fishing trawler for a shipwreck you could spawn. I'm thinking it would be fun to have to rescue multiple kerbals so there is a necessity to bring larger rescue ships or even Thunderbird 2 to the scene if you can be evil / fun enough to make it a mission to recover the entire vessel!
Some interesting building techniques and great looking craft. Thanks for sharing with us!

Somewhere off the coast a clandestine rendezvous at sea took place.

Don't worry, the speedboat was not filled with contraband. It was just a shakedown cruise for the WaveRunner PC-1 speedboat, released separately in another thread. It's a very simple small boat powered by 2 concealed Juno engines, perfect for your Kerbal's first marine license and those overnight supply runs to Key West.

Edited November 13, 2015 by pandoras kitten
Very nice craft! Reminds me of something I made back in 0.90 (I think).
Wow this thing looks incredibly good! Nice flag btw :-D

When I'm not working on STS stuff:

Contract Pack: SSI Aerospace

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/138997-WIP-Contract-Pack-SSI-Aerospace-%280-0-2%29-Early-Career-Air-Charters-%28Giving-Aircraft-a-Purpose%29

Released version 0.0.2, added KSC Coast Guard rescue contract:

S.S. Minnow spawns in the ocean (you have to load the vessel from Tracking Center after accepting contract to prevent Kerbals from sink-spawning to bottom of ocean):

PandorasKitten PBY craft (not included)

The pack is more fun with KAX parts and KAS winches . Here's a helicopter I made with Kerbal Aircraft eXpansion kuey rotor and tail rotor:

And pandoras kitten PBK with some KAX engines I added:

Now to think of a way to get it to randomly spawn in a general area with different ships and crews...

I see where you got the name from, nice! But can you actually make a detailed PBY Catalina? Take that as a friendly challenge. ;)
[IMG]http://cdn.silodrome.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/03/Consolidated-PBY-Catalina-Plane.jpg[/IMG]
[IMG]http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-Nf6_wUkUvPA/UsR_oQzOHeI/AAAAAAAACHo/_zcOc99_ZqY/s640/PBY-Catalina-wallpaper.jpg[/IMG]
If part count weren't a limit, anything is possible.

Awesome craft, I've adapted it to FAR today. Had to make some changes but it flies very well/ Also, KAX engines, and adjustable landing gear, just because I had them.
Added water rudder - FAR supports very simple hydrodynamic, so it really adds stability while on water.
Now the question, how to get it to Laythe?
